security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based guidance document with no executable code. The skill provides TDD workflow instructions and code pattern examples for Firebase development. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities detected.

content.user_title: Add features to Firebase projects with TDD
content.value_statement: Adding features to Firebase projects requires following security patterns, writing tests first, and verifying with emulators. This skill provides a step-by-step TDD workflow for Cloud Functions, Firestore collections, and API endpoints.
actual_capabilities: Guides TDD workflow with test-first development
Creates Cloud Functions with proper authentication
Adds Firestore collections with security rules
limitations: Does not create new Firebase projects

use_cases.title: Add new API endpoints
use_cases.description: Create Express routes and Cloud Functions with proper auth and validation

use_cases.title: Add Firestore collections
use_cases.description: Add new collections with security rules, indexes, and emulator testing

use_cases.title: Implement scheduled functions
use_cases.description: Create cron jobs with test coverage and emulator verification

prompt_templates.prompt: Add a Cloud Function that triggers when new messages are created

prompt_templates.prompt: Create a callable function that sends notifications to users

prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new posts collection with security rules that allow users to edit only their own posts

output_examples.input: Add a new HTTP endpoint for creating orders in my Firebase project
output: Created TodoWrite checklist with 12 steps for TDD workflow
Wrote failing test first for order creation handler
Created order handler with authentication and validation
Added Firestore security rules for orders collection
Implemented Express route with response pattern

best_practices: Always write tests before implementing features (TDD requirement)
Use the {success, message, data?} response pattern for consistency
Add ABOUTME comments to every file explaining its purpose
Verify all changes with Firebase emulators before deployment
anti_patterns: Skipping tests to move faster - tests catch bugs early
Writing to client collections without proper security rules
Not validating input at every layer (defense in depth)

faq.question: What is the TDD workflow for Firebase features?
faq.answer: Write failing tests first, implement feature to pass tests, then verify with Firebase emulators. The skill provides a 12-step checklist.

faq.question: Does this skill work with all Firebase project structures?
faq.answer: Yes, it detects Express API, domain-grouped, and individual function file patterns and adapts accordingly.

faq.question: What authentication methods are supported?
faq.answer: Both API Key authentication (server-side validation) and Firebase Auth (client-side) are supported.

faq.question: Is emulator testing required?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill requires emulator verification before marking any feature as complete.

faq.question: Can I add features to multiple hosting sites?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports multi-hosting setups with proper rewrite configurations.

faq.question: How does this differ from firebase-development:project-setup?
faq.answer: project-setup creates new Firebase projects, while add-feature extends existing projects with new functions, endpoints, and collections.
